alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 17 at 1:35PM MST until November 20 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations generally 10 to 15 inches for the Wasatch Mountains, 12 to 18 inches possible in the Upper Cottonwoods with the highest amounts up to 24 inches, and 8 to 12 inches in the western Uintas. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected, especially across high elevation seasonal routes that are still open, such as SR-39 Monte Cristo, SR-65 East Canyon, and SR-150 Mirror Lake Highway.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains
